properties.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 15 at 3:00PM PST until January 16 at 8:00PM PST by NWS Reno NV
properties.description:
* WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 2 to 5 inches
above 5000 feet. In the lowest valleys including the Reno metro
area accumulations of a 1/2 to 2 inches. Winds gusting as high
as 65 mph.

* WHERE...Greater Reno-Carson City-Minden Area.

* WHEN...From noon to 8 PM PST Thursday.

* IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. The hazardous
conditions will impact the evening commute with low visibility
and slick road conditions. Strong winds could cause tree damage.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...
properties.instruction:
Even light snowfall causes major travel delays, especially during
periods of high traffic volume. Be sure to allow extra time to
reach your destination. Leave extra space between vehicles since
it takes longer to stop on slick roadways.

The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

NWSheadline: WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM NOON TO 8 PM PST THURSDAY
